topics.body: To throw in some provocative statements into that Religion talk: Jesus was just a big hippy, so I see no reason to take his teachings seriously myself.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52d8ea8f6368720304360100#post_52d8ea8f6368720304360100
He seemed like a pretty nice person; although if he was around today chances are he would get crucified anyhow regardless of how much times have changed.

I may be a different religion now, but even I have to respect such a individual.

The problem is though his messages about forgiveness and the idea of "he who lives by the sword dies by the sword" and such are still massively unpopular beliefs even for christians.  If he was alive today he would get gut shot by a angry person yelling about he's a, "hippy commie out to destroy 'murrica".

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52d8ea8f6368720304360100#post_52d8ea8f6368720304360100

Funnily enough, I had a discussion with a friend of mine about an alternate history wher Jesus wasn't put on the cross.

We concluded that past 40 he would have burned out, turning into the Classical-era Ted Nugent. Going on to fire arrows into the air outside the Hippodrome and riffing on Samaritans and other non-Jews/Romans.

Ultimately, Christianity would become more violent and nutty, and Islam would be more of a "we're tired of your shit, Rome" perspective. Mohhamad would teach more along our-Jesus and beat-poem alternate-Jesus out of the equation before unfortunately dying by being plowed over by a woman driving a camel; this then becoming the new symbol of Islam.

And all Jihads were fought be deploying rigged out, SUV-like camels directed by women.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
So today, my Muslim friend discovered that, by the rules of her religion, she's not allowed to talk to men.

She had lived years not knowing this, and after a strange turn of events, an argument with her mother ended in "What?! You want to visit a _man_ in a _cafe?_ (for the record, no, no she didn't) You're not even allowed to talk to boys, it's a sin!"

And this has absolutely devastated my friend. Many of her friends are guys, and she has no intention to stop talking to them. She's had to change names in her phone's address book (example: Carlos to Carla) because she's afraid her mom will check her phone - every message that my friend sends gets forwarded to her mother's phone; she's had to download apps like Kik to get around this. And this is the same woman who accused her daughter of being a lesbian because a female friend texted her "love you!" on her birthday.

It fucking kills me, because here's a girl who's really dedicated to her religion. Loves going to the mosque, prays at the right times, all of it. And there's sections of it that she doesn't agree with: she doesn't wear a hijab, and her mom doesn't force her to. But this is the one part she won't bend on, and it's starting to cut into my friend's social life. There's a club that she loved to attend, and her mother saw her talking a guy there: now she's not allowed to come anymore. Because, according to her mom, "I didn't think you'd actually talk to the guys!"

Where am I going with this? It sucks to see someone so dedicated to something, but want to change parts of it because, let's face it, some of it is outdated, and have their mom crack down on it and treat her own daughter like she's a package of sins.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52da9932636872032d3c0400#post_52da9932636872032d3c0400
That's a very silly thing to make a sin out of.
topics.author: 4fddff15945b706cf6000520

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52da9932636872032d3c0400#post_52da9932636872032d3c0400

She must have some hyper-ass-Orthodox parents, because I couldn't find shit on that when scanning my own copy of the Koran for anything like that.

Just phrases about dressing modest, and at most the affirmation of marriage being more a contract of financial stability between a man and one or more girls. But in so far as I can tell: they should be able to talk.

Unless this is part of the Hadiths (which are fairly secondary), which I don't own.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
"@AaronMk":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52daaa5d6368723b18050000#post_52daaa5d6368723b18050000

Something about it seems fishy to me. Considering that she's not allowed to date, she's basically being forced into the family business, and all around isn't going to escape from her family any time soon, hey, it wouldn't surprise me if her mom made some shit up. 

Is it possible that it's a rule in a certain sect of Islam?
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52dab3236368723a7d220300#post_52dab3236368723a7d220300

As far as I know, there are two sects of Islam that could be considered fundie as shit: Salafists and Wahabists. I think the Wahabi are the more conservative, so probably them.

Otherwise, there are the Sunni and Shia. But those two are only different in regards to a succession feud over the Caliphate that's been running for too god-damn long (over a thousand years at this point). Then we got the under appreciated Suffis who place more emphasis on Islam's spiritualism than anything, and they like to spin.


But I have a friend who managed to date an Imam's daughter despite being non-Muslim. So I suspect there's something going on.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
"@AaronMk":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52dab49e6368723aa20c0000#post_52dab49e6368723aa20c0000

It sucks to see a parent so hellbent on controlling their daughter's life (she's done more shit, but out of respect, I won't say what) that they use a religion that their own child finds comfort in as a leash.

topics.body:
I would have less problems if I were physically aggressive and less morally sound.

I guarantee a good half of my issues would evaporate on the spot, and the other half would shrivel up and be dead within a week.

I feel my family is massively hypocritical regarding religion. If asked we will all say Christian, despite doing absolutely nothing resembling Christian values. And I would say it only because the few times I have brought it up with my mother, it's proven the most direct route to turning her into "Shrieking Self-righteous Embodiment of Intolerance".

I'm not sure if this is the best place for personal Bs, but there you go.
